title: Powell Says Fed Will Consider More-Aggressive Interest-Rate Increases to Reduce Inflation
sub_head: Bringing down inflation and avoiding recession will be ‘challenging task,’ says central bank leader
body:
Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said the central bank was prepared to raise interest rates in half-percentage-point steps and high enough to deliberately slow the economy if it concluded such steps were warranted to bring down inflation.
“If we think it’s appropriate to raise [by a half point] at a meeting or meetings, we will do so,” Mr. Powell said during a moderated discussion after a speech on Monday before the National Association for Business Economics in Washington, D.C.
